revised_title: Uncovering Henry Oldenburg's Private Life and Career
tldr: This article delves into the private life and career of Henry Oldenburg, a key figure in the Royal Society. It provides new insights into his early life, education, and activities between 1639 and 1653. The article also reveals details about his first marriage, his first wife's identity, and the source of his livelihood. Oldenburg's extensive travels and his linguistic abilities played a significant role in his career and connections with prominent figures of the time.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
